You're the reason they put directions on shampoo bottles.
You're not stupid; you just have bad luck thinking.
Your secrets are always safe with me. I never even listen when you tell me them.
You have something on your chin… no, the third one down.
If I had a dollar for every smart thing you say, I’d be broke.
You're like a cloud. When you disappear, it’s a beautiful day.
You bring everyone so much joy… when you leave the room.
You're not completely useless. You can always serve as a bad example.
You're the human version of a participation trophy.
You’re not the dumbest person alive, but you better hope they don’t die.
You have something on your face… it’s called failure.
Your brain is like a web browser with 19 tabs open. 17 are frozen, and you have no idea where the music is coming from.
You're like a software update. Whenever I see you, I think, 'Not now.'
You're the reason the gene pool needs a lifeguard.
You're proof that even evolution takes a break sometimes.
You're not ugly; you’re just… aesthetically challenged.
You're like a candle in the wind—weak and constantly annoying.
You're as useful as a screen door on a submarine.
You're not a hot mess. You're just a mess. A lukewarm mess.
You're the kind of person who brings a ruler to bed to see how long they sleep.
You're the reason I check the mirror in the morning — to remind myself I’m not you.
You're as sharp as a marble.
If I wanted to kill myself, I’d climb your ego and jump to your IQ.
You make onions cry.
You're the reason why shampoo has instructions.
You're the human equivalent of a typo.
You're so dense, light bends around you.
You're like a cloud of confusion — always hovering.
You're the poster child for birth control.
You're about as useful as an expired coupon.
You're not even worth the calories I burn talking to you.
You're a gray sprinkle on a rainbow cupcake.
You're like a broken pencil — pointless.
You're the square root of -1: you can't be real.
You're slower than a dial-up modem.
You're like a WiFi signal — strong one moment, gone the next.
You're more disappointing than an unsalted pretzel.
You're not just a clown. You’re the entire circus.
You're like a mystery meat sandwich at a school cafeteria.
You're so irrelevant, autocorrect doesn't even recognize your name.
You're like a participation award in human form.
You're about as helpful as a popup ad.
You're the background character in the story of your own life.
You're the kind of person who would trip over a cordless phone.
You're the reason some people believe in aliens — because they hope you're not one of us.
You're like a fortune cookie, but all the fortunes are blank.
You're the static cling of social interaction.
You're the kind of person Siri ignores.
You're as forgettable as yesterday's toast.
You're like a GPS with no signal — lost and loud.
